24613.title: Gate to the Garden of the Gods
24613.credit_line: Gift of Olive F. Whitman and Ray Jennings Morehouse, sister and brother of Lucille E. Morehouse, from the Lucille E. Morehouse Estate
24613.provenance: Given to the Indianapolis Museum of Art in 1965.
24613.inscription: inscribed in pencil, verso, L.L.: Gateway to the Garden of the Gods | signed in pencil, below image, L.R.:  Constance Forsyth
rights: © The Estates of William J. and Constance Forsyth

extended_text.content:
The Garden of the Gods is a city-owned nature preserve on the outskirts of Colorado Springs. Its towering rock formations made it a favorite sketching ground for students at the Broadmoor Art Academy in Colorado Springs.

Constance Forsyth, the daughter of Indiana painter William Forsyth, studied under Boardman Robinson at the Broadmoor in 1932 and 1934.
extended_text.title: Gallery Label

24613.exhibit_history: "Looking West", Indianapolis Museum of Art, Indianapolis, IN, 2/3/2012-8/5/2012
